author: Staff
title: What Are the Benefits of Investing in New Construction Homes in Orlando?
text:
Buying a home is a significant decision, and choosing a new property offers unique advantages. Investing in new construction, Orlando provides many benefits for homebuyers, from modern amenities to lower maintenance costs. This article explores why opting for a newly built home in Orlando can be smart for first-time buyers and seasoned investors.
Modern Designs and Features One major benefit of new construction homes is the availability of modern designs and features. New homes are built with the latest architectural styles, often including open floor plans, large windows, and smart home technologies. These contemporary features make the living spaces more functional and attractive. Buyers can also enjoy modern kitchens with energy-efficient appliances, spacious master suites, and updated bathrooms. Having these features in place means there is no need for immediate renovations or upgrades, which can save time and money.
Customization Opportunities Investing in new construction allows buyers to customize their homes according to their preferences. Many builders offer various options for floor plans, interior finishes, and exterior designs. This flexibility means buyers can choose the colors, materials, and fixtures that best suit their style and needs. Customization can include choosing the type of flooring, cabinetry, countertops, and paint colors. Having the chance to personalize a new home is a significant advantage over purchasing an older home, where changes can be costly and time-consuming.
Energy Efficiency and Sustainability New construction homes are designed with energy efficiency in mind. Builders use the latest materials and construction techniques to ensure homes are well-insulated and energy-efficient. Features like double-pane windows, energy-efficient HVAC systems, and LED lighting help reduce energy consumption, leading to lower utility bills. Some new homes also come with solar panels or smart thermostats, further enhancing their sustainability. Investing in a new, energy-efficient home benefits the environment and helps homeowners save money in the long run.
Lower Maintenance Costs A significant advantage of new construction homes is lower maintenance costs than older properties. New homes are built with high-quality materials and meet current building codes, making them less likely to have immediate repair issues. New homes often have warranties covering major systems like plumbing, electrical, and roofing for several years. This provides peace of mind to homeowners, knowing they won’t have to deal with unexpected repair costs shortly after moving in.
Growing Communities and Amenities Orlando is known for its vibrant neighborhoods and growing communities. Investing in new construction in Orlando often means becoming part of a newly developed community with modern amenities. Many new communities offer parks, swimming pools, fitness centers, and walking trails. These features provide residents with a higher quality of life and make new neighborhoods appealing to families, professionals, and retirees alike. Additionally, being in a new community can foster a sense of camaraderie and belonging among neighbors.
Investing in new construction in Orlando has many advantages, including modern designs, customization options, energy efficiency, lower maintenance costs, and access to growing communities with excellent amenities. These benefits make new homes attractive for those looking to buy in Orlando. By choosing a newly built property, homebuyers can enjoy a comfortable, efficient, and personalized living space that meets their needs and enhances their lifestyle.

author: @alltop
title: Biden announces new aid package for Ukraine - Alltop Viral
text: Biden announces new aid package for UkrainePosted by [Thomas Bush](https://alltop.com/viral/author/thomas)/ December 28, 2023 President [Biden has unveiled a new aid package for Ukraine](https://www.defense.gov/News/Releases/Release/Article/3627179/biden-administration-announces-new-security-assistance-for-ukraine/). [Russia is preparing a major offensive as the ground freezes](https://euromaidanpress.com/2023/12/20/russia-preparing-major-offensive-in-avdiivka-as-ground-freezes-warns-white-house/). [Russian drones are allegedly dropping tear](https://www.businessinsider.com/ukrainian-troops-say-russian-drones-are-dropping-tear-gas-choking-starting-fires-2023-12) gas on Ukrainian troops on the front lines. President Zelenksy has [denied that Ukraine is losing its war against Russia](https://www.bbc.com/news/live/world-67760177?src_origin=BBCS_BBC). [Putin tells Russia that his aims with the war are unchanged](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-67711802). [Putin has admitted that Russia has suffered tremendous losses in Ukraine](https://www.newsweek.com/putin-admits-russia-suffered-huge-losses-ukraine-1852660). [The US is going to issue another round of funding to Ukraine](https://www.defense.gov/News/Releases/Release/Article/3615582/biden-administration-announces-new-security-assistance-for-ukraine/). Earlier this week, more than [100 European countries encouraged the United States](https://www.pravda.com.ua/eng/news/2023/12/11/7432632/) to offer more funding to Ukraine. [Zelensky is set to travel to Washington again](https://www.kyivpost.com/post/25285). The [White House has said the cost of not supporting Ukraine is too high](https://kyivindependent.com/white-house-costs-of-not-supporting-ukraine-too-high-to-pay/). [Aid to Ukraine has fallen](https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2023-12-07/new-aid-to-ukraine-drops-to-lowest-level-since-war-began?leadSource=reddit_wall) to its lowest level since the war began. The [White House has warned of an urgent need to send more aid to Ukraine.](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-us-canada-67585902) [Russian soldiers executed two surrendering Ukrainian soldiers](https://www.kyivpost.com/post/24977). [Russians’ support of the war is falling dramatically](https://www.euronews.com/2023/12/02/russians-support-of-ukraine-war-collapses-finds-poll), according to a recent poll. [Russia is paying off military wives to stave off criticism](https://inews.co.uk/news/world/russia-paying-off-soldiers-wives-silence-anti-war-dissent-2788669) before the next election. [Putin is pushing Russian women to have as many as 8 kids](https://www.businessinsider.com/ukraine-war-putin-urges-russians-8-kids-amid-demographic-crisis-2023-11). [Russia suffered its worst losses of the war so far](https://www.semafor.com/article/11/29/2023/ukraine-russia-war-updates-russia-suffers-worst-month-for-casualties-uk-says) this November. [Audio intercepted from Russia troops fighting in Ukraine](https://apnews.com/article/ukraine-war-russian-soldiers-intercepted-audio-d2418788051731a32689feb821cd29ec?user_email=a72137fca6de941f924bfd282515a6cd53e072240494d19ed4a1c9b8a677ff62&utm_term=Afternoon+Wire) suggest they’re getting tired of the war. [Ukraine has regained more ground](https://english.nv.ua/nation/russians-have-nothing-similar-to-surovikin-line-on-left-bank-50371231.html) in Kherson Oblast. [Ukraine is claiming to have pushed Russian forces back as far as five miles,](https://www.businessinsider.com/ukraine-pushed-russian-forces-back-2-5-miles-from-dnipro-river-banks-2023-11) which would be the first meaningful success of the counteroffensive. Zelensky has warned [Ukrainians to be prepared for intensified Russian](https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/zelenskiy-tells-ukrainians-prepare-russian-winter-onslaught-2023-11-12/) attacks this winter. [Ukraine has enough energy resources](https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/ukraine-has-enough-energy-resources-get-through-winter-energy-minister-2023-11-12/) to make it through the winter. [Ukraine has destroyed a major Russian warship](https://www.kyivpost.com/post/23747). Ukraine has warned that, without more help from allies, it is entering a [war of attrition with Russia](https://www.cnn.com/2023/11/03/world/ukraine-president-warns-long-attritional-war/index.html). [Russia has attacked the largest number of settlements](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-67283305) in one day since the beginning of the war. [Russian soldiers have been accused of killing a family of nine](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-67262610) people for refusing to give up their house. [Russia’s new assault on Ukraine is causing heavy casualties](https://www.euronews.com/2023/10/27/war-in-ukraine-russia-suffering-significant-losses-in-new-offensive-white-house-says), according to the U.S. [Russia has begun a massive assault across the eastern front](https://kyivindependent.com/russia-intensifies-attacks-along-much-of-eastern-front/). There is [fierce fighting in eastern Ukraine as Russia](https://www.cnn.com/2023/10/13/europe/russia-attack-avdiivka-ukraine-intl/index.html) steps up its assaults. [Russia launched a large attack in eastern Ukraine](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-67095103). Putin has claimed that [Russia successfully tested a nuclear-powered cruise missile](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-67021695), which would have a potentially unlimited range. There is no proof that his claims are true. A [Russian airstrike has killed 51 people at a Ukraine funeral](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-67022615). [Russia is trying to get back on the UN human rights council.](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-66919358) In the latest (and most disturbing) Russian propaganda ad, [Russian soldiers say they hope to live in conquered Ukraine cities](https://www.yahoo.com/news/russian-soldiers-dream-conquering-ukrainian-032433973.html). Taiwan is complaining [China is harassing them by flying 103 planes](https://apnews.com/article/taiwan-china-flights-b8a78493341bd3af15f4fd58be692e4d) towards the island’s airspace. The [United States will give Taiwan $345 million in military](https://apnews.com/article/taiwan-military-aid-china-support-06e61a0e0ed787ea120f839ef59885fa) aid. [Taiwan is using Ukraine as a model as they prepare for possible Chinese aggression](https://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/jul/09/ukrainian-strategy-has-become-a-model-taiwanese-beef-up-military-to-face-china-threat). [China has simulated an attack on key Taiwanese targets](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-65223970) China’s foreign minister has [warned the United States not to cross its “red line”](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2022/12/23/us-must-stop-unilateral-bullying-chinas-foreign-minister-says) with “bullying” tactics. China claims it drove off a [US naval cruiser near the Spratly](https://www.reuters.com/world/china/china-says-it-drove-away-us-cruiser-that-illegally-intruded-waters-near-south-2022-11-29/) Islands. [China has warned of a potential arms race](https://globalnews.ca/news/9238670/china-arms-race-b52-bombers-australia/) after learning that the US was sending [nuclear-capable bombers to Australia](https://www.wsj.com/articles/u-s-plans-to-send-b-52-bombers-to-australia-in-effort-to-counter-china-11667268615). President Biden has said that the [United States would defend Taiwan if China invaded](https://www.dw.com/en/biden-us-forces-would-defend-taiwan-if-china-invades/a-63166248). [China has been simulating attacking United States](https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/taiwan-says-china-has-been-simulating-attacks-us-navy-ships-2022-09-01) ships, according to Taiwan. Taiwan [shot down a Chinese drone](https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/taiwan-shoots-down-unidentified-drone-kinmen-2022-09-01/); yesterday, [Taiwan fired on a Chinese drone](https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/taiwan-president-restraint-does-not-mean-it-wont-counter-china-2022-08-30/) that invaded its airspace.More than [50 Chinese warplanes and 6 warships](https://focustaiwan.tw/cross-strait/202208180020) have been spotted near Taiwan. [Chinese aircraft have entered Taiwanese](https://www.aninews.in/news/world/asia/17-chinese-military-aircraft-5-ships-cross-taiwan-strait-median-line20220817113038/) airspace yet again. Just two weeks ago, Taiwan scrambled jets as 22 [Chinese aircraft invade Taiwanese airspace](https://www.reuters.com/world/china/taiwan-scrambles-jets-22-chinese-fighters-cross-taiwan-strait-median-line-2022-08-03/). [Australia’s defense minister has said that China’s military buildup is the “most ambitious” since WWII](https://www.newsweek.com/china-military-buildup-most-ambitious-since-wwii-australia-warns-marles-lloyd-austin-1714923) and could endanger geopolitical stability. [China has launched an AI-piloted, unmanned naval ship capable of carrying and launching dozens of drones](https://www.businessinsider.com/china-launches-worlds-first-ai-unmanned-drone-aircraft-carrier-2022-6). [Taiwan has deployed advanced, fourth generation fighter jets in a show of force](https://thehill.com/policy/international/asia-pacific/582095-taiwan-deploys-advanced-fighter-jets-amid-tensions-with) to stand up to China. China has fifth-generation fighter jets, but so does the United States, who has backing Taiwan. [The president of Taiwan has said that the threat from China is increasing every day](https://www.cnn.com/2021/10/27/asia/tsai-ingwen-taiwan-china-interview-intl-hnk/index.html), and she has confirmed that there are US military trainers assisting the Taiwanese. Last week, [Chinese President Xi Jinping vowed to achieve a “peaceful reunification” with Taiwan](https://www.reuters.com/world/china/chinas-xi-says-reunification-with-taiwan-must-will-be-realised-2021-10-09/), despite the threatening presence of Chinese fighters in Taiwanese airspace over the past months. In response, the [Taiwanese president has vowed to defend Taiwan’s sovereignty](https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/taiwan-president-pledge-defence-sovereignty-democracy-2021-10-09/). [Biden has sided with China as tensions heat up between China and Taiwan, reiterating that the U.S. will abide by the “one China” policy](https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/biden-says-he-chinas-xi-have-agreed-abide-by-taiwan-agreement-2021-10-05/)––meaning the US will follow the Chinese assertion that Taiwan is its territory. [Taiwan has recorded a record number of Chinese jets in its airspace](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-58794094). This past summer, Chinese jets entered Taiwanese airspace multiple times. In June, [China sent a massive force of 28 aircraft into Taiwanese airspace, including nuclear-capable bombers,](https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/taiwan-reports-largest-incursion-yet-by-chinese-air-force-2021-06-15/) the largest and most threatening show of force yet. [The Chinese government, angered by recent developments between the U.S. and Taiwan, has warned the U.S. State Department to “stop all forms” of official outreach to Taiwan](https://www.tampafp.com/china-warns-state-department-to-stop-all-forms-of-official-outreach-to-taiwan/). This might actually signal a warming of tensions, consider a few months ago [China was threatening to fly fighter jets over Taiwan if U.S.-Taiwan relations continued to warm](https://www.newsweek.com/china-fighter-jets-will-fly-over-taiwan-declare-sovereignty-state-media-says-1583109). China also threatened “all-out war” if Taiwan fires on the jets. That same time, [Taiwan reported the largest incursion by the Chinese air force yet](https://www.reuters.com/article/taiwan-china-defense/update-1-taiwan-reports-largest-incursion-yet-by-chinese-air-force-idUSL1N2M516J). [The United States said it would defend Taiwan in the face of Chinese incursions into Taiwanese airspace a few months ago](https://www.rfa.org/english/news/china/defend-04082021105404.html). [China sent more fighter jets into Taiwanese air space as a result, escalating their show of force](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-taiwan-defence/taiwan-says-will-fight-to-the-end-if-china-attacks-idUSKBN2BU0HJ). [Taiwan threatened to shoot down the Chinese drones in its airspace, if they get too close to the Taiwanese-controlled Pratas Islands](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-southchinasea-taiwan/taiwan-says-may-shoot-down-chinese-drones-in-south-china-sea-idUSKBN2BU1CV). [Chinese drones were spotted gathering intelligence around Taiwan, according to the Taiwanese coast guard](https://www.newsweek.com/chinese-drones-spotted-gathering-intel-around-taiwan-islands-1580348). [Eleven Chinese warplanes flew into Taiwanese airspace on Monday, part of China’s rising imperial aspirations](https://www.newsweek.com/chinese-warplanes-buzz-around-taiwan-pincer-movement-1579692). Earlier this month, [China, as part of its usual change-of-presidency bellicosity, warned the United States against interfering with China’s designs on Taiwan](https://www.newsweek.com/china-necessary-measures-taiwan-resolutely-defend-us-1576956). Earlier this year, [China called Taiwan an “insurmountable red line.”](https://www.dw.com/en/china-warns-us-not-to-cross-red-line-on-taiwan/a-56798946) More [news.](https://alltop.com/news)

author: IANS
title: Gas prices to fall in 2024; Americans likely to save $32bn on fuel: Experts - Investing.com India
text:
New York, Dec 28 (IANS) Gas prices across the US are projected to fall in the new year in 2024 for the second successive year resulting in a net saving of about $32 billion on fuel costs for the Americans.Oil experts predict that US gas prices will average $3.38 a gallon in the key election year of 2024 representing a significant improvement from this year's average of $3.51 a gallon and an even bigger drop from the average of 2022 of $3.95.
Gas prices skyrocketed to record highs that year as Russia's invasion of Ukraine set off global shockwaves, media reports said.
Gas stations around the country boosted prices by an average of 26 cents a gallon over the past month, as irregular temperatures made fuel-making more challenging due to the slowing of cooling processes needed to refine crude oil .
Even as the Russia-Ukraine war still lingers and there is a risk the Israel-Hamas war spills into a regional conflict, GasBuddy, an oil and gas analyst, is betting drivers will get more relief in 2024.
GasBuddy expects Americans will spend about $32 billion less on fuel than in 2023 and $79 billion less than in 2022.
"Next year should represent a continued march towards what most Americans would consider normal prices at the pump," Patrick De Haan, GasBuddy's head of petroleum analysis, told CNN.
The price drop forecast bodes well for consumers. White House can exercise caution as optimism emerges while fighting an uphill battle trying to sell its economic message to a sceptical public, CNN analysts wrote.
Cheaper gas prices would give the Federal Reserve a carte blanche as it seeks to pull off a rare soft landing of the US economy by taming inflation without starting a recession. The Feds closely monitor gas prices but it's not included in its "core" inflation gauge.
"Gas prices may still be a bit elevated but considering wage growth, it is taking less of Americans' hard work to pay for that gallon of gasoline," De Haan said.
GasBuddy doesn't see gas prices averaging $4 a gallon in any single month next year.
The US is an energy power house that pumps more oil than any other country in the world , according to S&P Global (NYSE: SPGI ) Insights.
In December 2022, GasBuddy projected gas prices would average $3.49 a gallon in 2023. That forecast was nearly spot-on, with actual gas prices averaging $3.51 a gallon so far this year.
--IANS
ash/pgh

author: @wectnews
title: Local seafood restaurant becomes hot spot after viral video
text: Local seafood restaurant becomes hot spot after viral video WILMINGTON, N.C. (WECT) - A seafood restaurant in Wilmington is getting some out-of-town visitors to this popular hot spot. But these aren’t typical tourists, they’re social media surfers stopping by the check out the menu. “It’s insane,” said Darren Keeler with Shuckin’ Shack. “At last check, the video had almost three million views in a matter of days.” The video Keeler is talking about is Adam Moran’s food channel called “Beard Meets Food”. He’s a competitive eater from across the pond who came to Wilmington to try the hidden secret lobster roll on Shuckin’ Shack’s menu. “If you know, you know,” said Keeler. “It’s the “Mega Gregga.” The meal is a lobster roll feast with fries and slaw that weighs in at a whopping eight pounds! “The owner just told me it’s gonna weigh 8 pounds; this is gonna be tough,” said Moran in his viral video. “Hopefully I can do it; I don’t know.” Well, he did do it, as the video documents. Moran finished the platter in a little more than 40 minutes, and that meal has become a viral sensation. Shuckin’ Shack, downtown, goes through anywhere from two to four thousand oysters a week. It’s ironic it’s getting this international attention for a lobster roll that’s not printed on the menu. It’s word of mouth. “Oh, making it was fun,” said chef Zach Watford. But it’s not just about food. It’s about friends and fellowship. “Shuckin’ Shack. I like to tell people who work here and our customers that the shack part is important,” said Watford. “We’re not fancy, we’re not pretentious; we take pride in what we do.” Up for the challenge? Give a Shuckin’ Shack 24 hours’ notice. If you finish the meal, you get a free dinner, a t-shirt, and bragging rights. If you don’t finish the meal, well, you’re out $200 and your face gets plastered on the restaurant’s “Wall of Shame.” “Beard Meats Food” has brought the restaurant some global notoriety. The management team must have done something right. This restaurant, which had its original location in Carolina Beach, has grown to a franchise of 18, with five more in development to open within the next year. Basking in the glow of Adam Moran’s fame, and the over 3 million followers are just icing on the cake. “As a businessman, the moral is simple,” said Keeler. “Respond to everyone who reaches out on Facebook or Messenger to your business, because you don’t know who that’s gonna be.” To learn more about Adam Moran’s fame as he eats his way across the globe in “Beard Meats Food” [click here](https://www.youtube.com/watch?si=aNxWIZ8Ou7OTaELz&v=M0CX9rjiVCY&feature=youtu.be). Copyright 2024 WECT. All rights reserved.

author: Смотрим
title: DS: у Трампа заподозрили деменцию после странного ответа на вопрос журналистов
text:
Главные события3 июля 2025, 07:02 3 июля 2025, 08:02 3 июля 2025, 09:02 3 июля 2025, 10:02 3 июля 2025, 11:02 3 июля 2025, 12:02 3 июля 2025, 13:02 3 июля 2025, 14:02 3 июля 2025, 15:02 3 июля 2025, 16:02 3 июля 2025, 17:02
DS: у Трампа заподозрили деменцию после странного ответа на вопрос журналистов
Подозрения у журналистов возникли после того, как репортер Fox News задал ему вопрос, как долго будут содержать мигрантов, попавших в новый центр их содержания. В ответ Трамп начал пространные рассуждения о своей работе в Овальном кабинете, Флориде и том, что планирует задержаться в штате как можно дольше.
"Затем он продолжил разглагольствовать о налогах в Нью-Йорке, прежде чем завершить свой ответ, заявив: "Но большое спасибо, я буду здесь столько, сколько смогу", – говорится в публикации.
Часть общественности восприняла ответ Трампа так, будто он отнес себя к содержащимся в открытом им центре мигрантам, что вызвало бурную реакцию в соцсетях и опасения о его психическом здоровье, подытожило издание.
Ранее The Washington Post рассказала, что Трамп попросил медиков оставить ему снимок компьютерной томографии головного мозга, сделанный после покушения на него в Пенсильвании в 2024 году.

author: Kelly Fisher
title: Watch Tyler Hubbard Hilariously Reveal Why He Had An Encounter With Police | 98.1 KVET
text:
Photo: Getty Images
When Tyler Hubbard recorded one of the tracks on his newly-released sophomore solo album, a memory resurfaced of a moment he had a run-in with police.
Hubbard reminisced on that moment when he appeared on The Kelly Clarkson Show on Thursday morning (April 18). The country hitmaker told host Kelly Clarkson , “halfway through the song, as we were writing it…I was starting to have a flashback. I’m like, ‘I remember when I was 15, I got caught parking in a parking lot with my girlfriend, who was 16 and had her own car.”
Clarkson pointed out that that Hubbard’s story took place in a church parking lot, garnering a surprised laugh from the audience. Hubbard replied that the church parking lot “is supposed to be the safest spot to be. …No judgement. We were leaving enough room in the middle for Jesus,” he insisted as Clarkson laughed and replied, “no, you were not!”
“It’s this big, dramatic thing,” Hubbard remembered. “(The) cop pulls up, I’m thinking he’s gonna be cool. He’ll just tell us to go home. No. He wanted to make an example out of us. So, he gets us all flustered and then he’s like, ‘I’m gonna drive you home. We’re gonna talk to your dad, your parents.’ I’m like, ‘bro.’ Isn’t there like a bro code here or something like this? …So, he took me home, made me go tell my dad the whole scenario. Although I was grounded for like a month from seeing my girlfriend or riding in her car, which is really unfortunate at 15 years old. …My dad was like, ‘son, why didn’t you just come park in the driveway?’ I’m like — next time, dad. Yeah. Next time.”
Hubbard’s sophomore solo album, Strong , made its debut on April 12. In addition to “Park,” the 13-track album includes “Wish You Would,” “A Lot With A Little,” “Back Then Right Now,” “Vegas,” the title track and other highlights. Hubbard is listed as a songwriter on every track, including a solo credit on “'73 Beetle.” Find the full album on iHeartRadio here , and listen to “ Park ” below.
